title: Wrike Audit
descriptionMarkdown: The Wrike Audit data connector is used to ingest audit log data from wrike user acccounts. Wrike is a well-known Project Management Software which is widely used in various corporations. The data is ingested using Wrike REST API [https://developers.wrike.com]

dataTypes.name: auditLog_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
auditLog_CL
| summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
| where isnotempty(Time)

value:
auditLog_CL
| summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
| project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

instructionSteps.description:
**STEP 1-** Obtaining permanent access token for Wrike API.
[Follow the instructions](https://developers.wrike.com/oauth-20-authorization) to obtain the credentials

**STEP 2-** Choose one of the following deployment options to deploy the connector and the associated Azure functions.

>**NOTE:** To acquire the Workspace-Id and Primary Key copy from the following

instructionSteps.title: Option-1 ARM Template
instructionSteps.description: Use the following method to automatically deploy the data connector using an ARM Template and Azure Function Apps.

**Deploy the ARM Template**

1. Click the **Deploy to Azure** button below.
2. Select the preferred **Subscription**, **Resource Group** and **Region**.
>**NOTE :** Within the same resource group, you can't mix Windows and Linux apps in the same region. Select existing resource group without Windows apps in it or create new resource group.

3. Provide your **Workspace ID**, **Workspace Key**, **Wrike Access Token** into the various fields.
4. Mark the checkbox labeled **I agree to the terms and conditions stated above.**
5. Click **Review+Create** to deploy.

**Deploy the Function App**

> **NOTE:** You will need to [prepare VS code](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-functions/functions-create-first-function-python#prerequisites) for Azure function development.

1. Download the [Azure Function App]() file. Extract archive to your local development computer.
2. Start VS Code. Choose File in the main menu and select Open Folder.
3. Select the top level folder from extracted files.
4. Choose the Azure icon in the Activity bar, then in the **Azure: Functions** area, choose the **Deploy to function app** button.
If you aren't already signed in, choose the Azure icon in the Activity bar, then in the **Azure: Functions** area, choose **Sign in to Azure**
If you're already signed in, go to the next step.
5. Provide the following information at the prompts:

	a. **Select folder:** Choose a folder from your workspace or browse to one that contains your function app.

	b. **Select Subscription:** Choose the subscription to use.

	c. Select **Create new Function App in Azure** (Don't choose the Advanced option)

	d. **Enter a globally unique name for the function app:** Type a name that is valid in a URL path. The name you type is validated to make sure that it's unique in Azure Functions. (e.g. WrikeAuditXXXXX).

	e. **Select a runtime:** Choose Python 3.8.

	f. Select a location for new resources. For better performance and lower costs choose the same [region](https://azure.microsoft.com/regions/) where Azure Sentinel is located.

6. Deployment will begin. A notification is displayed after your function app is created and the deployment package is applied.
7. Go to Azure Portal for the Function App configuration.

instructionSteps.title: Option-2 Manual deployment
instructionSteps.description: Use the following step-by-step to deploy the Wrike Audit data connector manually (without azure functions)

**NOTE : ** Make sure you have python installed on your local computer and the path environment variable of your terminal contains the absolute path to where python is installed on your system.

1. Clone the repository 'Secure_WRIKE_using_AZURE_SENTINEL' into your local computer. Execute the following code in terminal for cloning.
>git clone https://github.com/ParanjoyG/Secure_WRIKE_using_AZURE_SENTINEL.git
2. Install required dependencies by executing the following command.
>pip install -r requirements.txt
3. Run the 'complete.py' file in your terminal using the following command.
>python3 complete.py
4. Enter the required credentials that you have obtained from above and the permanent access token of your Wrike API.
	1. WRIKE PERMANENT ACCESS TOKEN
	2. WORKSPACE ID
	3. PRIMARY/SECONDARY KEY

5. Press Enter to log data into your AZURE SENTINEL workspace.

**NOTE : ** If you have made a mistake while providing your credentials,it will raise an error and you can change your credentials in the 'details.txt' file whose path will be provided to you in the error message.
